decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Bhox Planning Design and Access Statement; 1087.01; 1087.03
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The hereby approved development shall not be occupied by more than two permanent residents (excluding staff) at any time.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring an appropriate form and function of development, and a high standard of accommodation in accordance with policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| No additional bedrooms shall be formed at any time without the express consent of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring an appropriate form and function of development, and a high standard of accommodation in accordance with policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the cycle storage facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of the stores, the location of the stores and the materials for the store. The approved storage areas shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:  Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Change of use from single dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to residential care home (Use Class C2) for children with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities ('SEND') or Learning Difficulties ('LD') or Emotional and Behavioural Difficulties ('EBD') and associated alterations.
